intro: Heliotropium gracillimum, commonly known as the slender heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 20–60 centimeters. The plant produces small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters at the ends of its branches. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Heliotropium gracillimum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in coastal areas due to its adaptability to saline conditions.
